column3: oups... wrong repository... I guess I still have some things to learn from Github. Please discard this!\n
A pull request is a request to get some of _your_ code pulled into Bitcoin. If you just want to check out the source code, use git clone/checkout.\n

Thanks for this reply. I really wanted to pull branches into a Bitcoin fork I made into Github (for practice). But I got confused by the meaning of the --all flag, which was applying to «all» repositories, not «all» branches like I tought. I'm really sorry for this mistake.\n
